etymology.description: Depicts a bed -> Original form of 牀(牀) (chuáng, "bed") -> Contracted form in 臧(臧) (zāng, "favored")
etymology.interpretation: The character 爿(pán, "bed") originally depicted the structure of a bed. It later became the foundational form for the character 牀(牀) (chuáng, "bed") and appears in a contracted form within the character 臧(臧) (zāng, "favored").

examples.chinese: 他躺在软软的爿上(他躺在軟軟的爿上)。
examples.pinyin: Tā tǎng zài ruǎn ruǎn de pán shàng.
examples.english: He lies on the soft bed.

examples.chinese: 夜深人静时(夜深人靜時)，爿边飘散着淡淡的香气(爿邊飄散着淡淡的香氣)。
examples.pinyin: Yè shēn rén jìng shí, pán biān piāo sàn zhe dàn dàn de xiāng qì.
examples.english: When the night is quiet, a faint fragrance drifts by the bed.

examples.chinese: 她精心整理过的爿让人看了舒心(她精心整理過的爿讓人看了舒心)。
examples.pinyin: Tā jīngxīn zhěnglǐ guò de pán ràng rén kàn le shūxīn.
examples.english: The bed she meticulously arranged looks very comforting.
